question: If  I  have  recovered  from  fever,  /  I  will  start  going  /  for swimming classes / from tomorrow. SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (1st Shift)

options.B: If I have recovered from fever

solution.correct_answer: B. If I have recovered from fever
solution.explanation: If I have recovered from fever The given sentence is an example of the ﬁrst conditional sentence and ‘If + Simple present … will + V 1 ’ is the correct grammatical structure for it. Hence, ‘If I recover from fever’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Last  night  I  dreamed  that  /  I  am  looking  for  the/ abominable snowman high / up in the Himalayas. SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.correct_answer: A. I am looking for the
solution.explanation: I am looking for the The given sentence is in the past tense, therefore, ‘am’ will be replaced with ‘was’ to indicate past continuous tense. Hence, ‘I was looking for the’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Three  segments  of  the  following  sentence  have  been underlined  and  given  as  options.  One  of  them  may  contain  an error.  Select  the  option  that  contains  the  error.  If  you  don’t  ﬁnd any error, mark ‘No error’ as your answer. When  my  father  will  come  ,  I  will  make  sure  that  I  discuss  the possibilities  of a new business venture with him. SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.correct_answer: C. When my father will come
solution.explanation: When my father will come ‘When’ is used to introduce a time clause, which is not written in the future tense. Rather, simple present tense is used to indicate the time of the main event. Hence, ‘When my father comes’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Soldiers  in  /  the  Indian  Armed  Forces  are  /  trained  never to / ﬁght cowardly. SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: trained never to The position of ‘never’ is incorrect in this sentence. Here, ‘never’ is used to modify the inﬁnitive ‘to ﬁght’, therefore it will be used between ‘to’ and ‘ﬁght’. Hence, ‘trained to never’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select the incorrect form of the verb. SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: strucken ‘Stricken’ is the correct verb form.

question: Identify  the  error  in  the  verb  form  in  the  following sentence  and  choose  the  correct  sentence  from  the  given options (Present Tense); The  committee  work  diligently  to  ensure  fair  and  unbiased decision. SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (2nd Shift)

options.A: The committee is work diligently to ensure fair and unbiased
options.B: The committee worked diligently to ensure fair and unbiased
options.C: The committee has work diligently to ensure fair and
options.D: The committee works diligently to ensure fair and unbiased

solution.correct_answer: D. The committee works diligently to ensure fair and unbiased
solution.explanation: The committee works diligently to ensure fair and unbiased decision. The given sentence is an example of simple present tense and follows the structure, ‘Singular subject + V-s/es’. Hence, option (d) is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  people  of  /  Jammu  and  Kashmir  /  has  emphasised and / appreciated transparency. SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: has emphasized and According to the “Subject-Verb Agreement Rule”, a singular subject always takes a singular verb and a plural subject always takes a plural verb. In the given sentence, ‘people’ is a plural subject that will take ‘have’ as a plural verb. Hence, ‘have emphasized and’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Himalayas  include  the  highest  mountains  in  the  world and feed almost 20% of the earth’s population. SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Himalayas include the Article ‘the’ is used before mountain ranges. ‘Himalayas’ is a mountain range. Hence, ‘The Himalayas include the’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  following  sentence  has  been  divided  into  four segments.  Identify  the  segment  that  contains  an  adverbial usage error; Mr Sukesh and / his family / ate the / food greedy. SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: food greedy The given sentence needs an adverb ‘greedily’ to modify the verb ‘ate’, not the adjective ‘greedy’. Hence, ‘food greedily’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Ramesh  licked  (A)  /  honey  and  (B)  /  said  that  (C)  /  it tasted sweetly  (D).  SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: (D) - it tasted sweet ‘Taste’ is a stative verb and we generally use an adjective with stative verbs. For example:- tastes sweet, smells nice, looks great, etc. Therefore, the adverb ‘sweetly’ will be replaced with the adjective ‘sweet’. Hence, ‘it tasted sweet’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Mrs Rani / works for / a international / school. SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: a international Article ‘an’ is used before the words beginning with a vowel sound (an apple, an umbrella, an American). Similarly, in the given sentence, the word ‘international’ begins with a vowel sound. Hence, ‘an international’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select the sentence that has a grammatical  error. SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (1st Shift)

options.A: I will be driving into town later on.
options.B: I might drive into town later on.
options.C: I could be driving into town later on.
options.D: I will be drive into town later on.

solution.correct_answer: D. I will be drive into town later on.
solution.explanation: I will be drive into town later on. ‘Will be + V ing ’ is the correct grammatical structure for the sentence which is in the future continuous tense. ‘Drive’ must be replaced with 'driving'. Hence, the sentence given in option (d) has an error.

question: Most  of  the  committee  /  are  here  to  /  decide  the  fate  of  / this ancient building. SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: are here to According to the “Subject-Verb Agreement Rule”, a singular subject always takes a singular verb and a plural subject always takes a plural verb. In the given sentence, ‘Most of the committee’ is a singular subject that will take ‘is’ as a singular verb. Hence, ‘is here to’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: When  Ramu  was  working  /  as  a  clerk,  /  he  asked  me money. SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: he asked me money ‘Asked me money’ must be replaced with ‘asked me for money’. The phrasal verb ‘ask for’ means to try to obtain something by requesting. Similarly, Ramu tried to obtain some money by requesting. Hence, ‘he asked me for money’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Identify  the  proper  explanation  of  the  error  in  the  given sentence. Mohan insisted to go there. SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (1st Shift)

options.A: Error is in the sentence formation. Preposition and gerund
options.B: Error is with the verb. The correct sentence should read like
options.C: Error is with the tense. The correct sentence should read like
options.D: Error is with the preposition. The correct sentence should

solution.correct_answer: A. Error is in the sentence formation. Preposition and gerund
solution.explanation: Error is in the sentence formation. Preposition and gerund are required. The correct sentence should read like this: Mohan insisted on going there.

question: There  are  four  tributaries  of  Ganga  and  it  is  ranked  as  the ﬁfth most polluted river of the world. SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (2nd Shift)

options.A: most polluted river of the world

solution.explanation: of Ganga and it ‘Ganga’ is a river and we generally use the deﬁnite article ‘the’ before the names of rivers. Hence, ‘of the Ganga and it’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  sons  of  the  old  farmer  /  fell  off  after  their  father  / breathed his last / in the village. SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (2nd Shift)

options.C: The sons of the old farmer

solution.correct_answer: B. fell off after their father
solution.explanation: fell off after their father ‘Fell off’ must be replaced with ‘fell apart’. The phrasal verb ‘fall apart’ means to become separated. The given passage talks about separation of the sons. Hence, ‘fell apart after their father’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: I had done / my cooking when / Vishnu came  to see me. SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: No error The given sentence is grammatically correct.

question: Had you been / working regularly, / you had  completed / the project yesterday. SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: you had completed ‘Would have’ is used to indicate the result of a past unreal condition. In the given sentence, ‘working regularly’ is the past unreal condition and ‘completing the project’ is its result. Hence, ‘you would have completed’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Raveena  has  made  /  up  her  mind  to  /  carried  minimum  / luggage with her. SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: carried minimum ‘To + V 1 ’, also known as inﬁnitive, is the correct grammatical structure. Hence, ‘carry(V 1 ) minimum’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: For the past / three years, / my uncle is /away  from home. SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: my uncle is ‘My uncle is’ must be replaced with ‘my uncle has been’. Present perfect tense (Singular Sub. + has + V 3 ) is used to indicate a state that has existed for some time. Hence, ‘my uncle has been(V 3 )’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Mr Raghav / brushes his / teeth four / times  the day SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: times the day Article ‘a’ is used to indicate the frequency of an action. For example:- twice a day, four times a day, etc. Hence, ‘times a day’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Mr Prabhakar was ﬁrst man to arrive at the  venue. SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: was ﬁrst man The article “the” is used before adjectives denoting rank, order or position. Therefore, article ‘the’ will be used before ‘ﬁrst’. Hence, ‘was the ﬁrst man’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Although  there  is  no  proven  data  ,  the  Centre  for  Policy Research  estimate  that  India  has  the  largest  stock  of  iron  ore  in the world. SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (3rd Shift)

options.C: Although there is no proven data,

solution.correct_answer: B. Centre for Policy Research estimate
solution.explanation: Centre for Policy Research estimate According to the “Subject-Verb Agreement Rule”, a singular subject always takes a singular verb and a plural subject always

question: He  has  been  (1)  watered  the  plants  (2)  for  one  hour.  (3) No error Higher Secondary 20/06/2024 (Shift - 2)

solution.explanation: watered the plants ‘Watered’ must be replaced with ‘watering’ as ‘Singular Sub + has been + V ing ’ is the correct grammatical structure for the sentence which is in present perfect continuous tense. The subject ‘he’ is singular. Hence, ‘watering the plants’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  toast  was  raised  in  honour  of  the  chairman  yesterday at hall. Higher Secondary 20/06/2024 (Shift - 2)

solution.explanation: yesterday at hall ‘Hall’ given in the sentence is speciﬁc and we use the deﬁnite article ‘the’ before speciﬁc or particular nouns. Hence, ‘yesterday at the hall’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Identify  the  error  in  the  verb  form  in  the  following sentence  and  choose  the  correct  sentence  from  the  given options (Present Tense). Earth revolve around the sun. Higher Secondary 21/06/2024 (Shift - 2)

options.B: Earth has revolve around the sun.
options.D: Earth are revolve around the sun.

solution.correct_answer: A. Earth revolves around the sun.
solution.explanation: Earth revolves around the sun. According to the “Subject-Verb Agreement Rule”, a singular subject always takes a singular verb. At the end of a singular verb, s/es is used. In the given sentence, ‘Earth’ is a singular subject that will take ‘revolves’ as a singular verb. Hence, ‘Earth revolves around the sun.’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Hiking  across  an  Himalayas  is  going  to  be  a  tough  task for a beginner. Higher Secondary 24/06/2024 (Shift - 2)

solution.explanation: an Himalayas is ‘Himalayas’ is a mountain range and we use the deﬁnite article ‘the’ before mountain ranges. Hence, ‘the Himalayas is’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Children  should  watch  TV  from  distance  as  it  will  affect their eyesight. Higher Secondary 25/06/2024 (Shift - 2)

solution.explanation: as it will affect We use simple present tense to state a scientiﬁc fact. It is a scientiﬁc fact that TV affects eyesight. Therefore, ‘will’ must be removed and the singular verb ‘affects’ will be used for the singular subject ‘it’. Hence, ‘as it affects’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: My  friends  /  and  their  family  members  /  have  gone  to  the beach / two days ago. Higher Secondary 25/06/2024 (Shift - 2)

solution.explanation: have gone to the beach The given sentence is in the past tense, so it must have the verb in the past form (V 2 ). ‘Went’ is the past form. Hence, ‘went to the beach’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Can we make sure we have a lots of fun on the  trip? Higher Secondary 26/06/2024 (Shift - 2)

solution.explanation: a lots of fun The correct phrase is ‘a lot of’. Its plural form is ‘lots of’. Therefore, ‘lot’ will be used in place of ‘lots’. Hence, ‘a lot of’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Paul  and  I  played  tennis  yesterday.  He’s  much  better  than me, so he win easily. Higher Secondary 26/06/2024 (Shift - 2)

options.A: Played tennis yesterday            (b) So he win easily
options.C: Paul and I                                     (d) He’s much better than me

solution.explanation: So he win easily The given sentence is in the past tense, so it must have the verbs in the past form(V 2 ), not in the present form(V 1 ). Therefore, ‘won’ will be used in place of ‘win’. Hence, ‘so he won(V 2 ) easily’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: King  Solomon  of  Israel  is  said  to  be  one  of  a  wisest  man who ruled the earth. Graduate Level 20/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: of a wisest man ‘One of + the + superlative adjective + plural noun’ is the correct grammatical structure. Therefore, article ‘the’ will be used in place of article ‘a’ and the plural noun ‘men’ will be used in place of ‘man’. Hence, ‘of the wisest men’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: He  was  consulted  seldom  by  his  colleagues  while making important decisions on ﬁnancial matters. Graduate Level 20/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

options.A: He was consulted seldom  (b) decisions on ﬁnancial matters.

solution.correct_answer: A. He was consulted seldom  (b) decisions on ﬁnancial matters.
solution.explanation: He was consulted seldom An adverb of frequency is generally placed after the helping verb and before the main verb in a sentence. Examples are :- often, always, seldom, never, etc. Therefore, ‘seldom’ will be placed after the helping verb ‘was’. Hence, ‘He was seldom consulted’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  Prime  Minister  and  a  President  are  visiting  the  town day to see the preparations of International Seminar. Graduate Level 21/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

options.B: the town day to see the

solution.explanation: a President are visiting ‘President’ is a speciﬁc person and we always use the deﬁnite article ‘the’ before speciﬁc or particular nouns. Hence, ‘the President are visiting’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  following  sentence  may  have  an  error  of  article. Choose  the  correct  sentence  from  the  given  options.  Choose  ‘No error’ if the sentence has no error. The  festivals  are  celebrated  everywhere  to  rejuvenate  the  minds of people Graduate Level 24/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

options.A: An festivals are celebrated everywhere to rejuvenate the
options.C: Festivals are celebrated everywhere to rejuvenate the minds
options.D: The festivals are celebrated everywhere to rejuvenate minds

solution.correct_answer: C. Festivals are celebrated everywhere to rejuvenate the minds
solution.explanation: Festivals are celebrated everywhere to rejuvenate the minds of people. We do not use any article when we refer to something in general. Therefore, article ‘the’ will be removed before the noun ‘festival’ as the given sentence is stating a general truth about festivals. Hence, the sentence given in option (c) has the correct use of article.

question: Identify the INCORRECT section of the given  sentence. Four people / were / witnesses of / that event. Graduate Level 24/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

solution.correct_answer: A. witnesses of    (b) that event.     (c) were
solution.explanation: witnesses of The preposition ‘to’ is used after the nouns ‘witness’ or ‘testimony’. And the correct structure is ‘witness/testimony to an event’. Hence, ‘witnesses to’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: We  have  to  be  cautius  regarding  the  impact  of  global warming. Graduate Level 25/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: be cautius ‘Cautious’ is the correct spelling.

question: Due  to  its  fragrance,  the  petals  of  an  rose  are  often  used in perfumes and cosmetics. Graduate Level 25/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: the petals of an Article ‘a’ is used before words beginning with the consonant sound. For example:- a conversation, a story. Similarly, in the given sentence, the word ‘rose’ begins with a consonant sound. Hence, ‘the petals of a rose’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: She  is  enough  wise  not  to  interfere  in  their  matter,  once being insulted publicly by them. Graduate Level 26/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: She is enough wise The adverb ‘enough’ is always used after the adjective. Similarly, in the given sentence, ‘enough’ will be used after the adjective ‘wise’. Hence, ‘She is wise enough’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Generally,  a  cycle  has  an  seat  and  handle  along  with  two pedals and a bell, sometimes a carrier too. Graduate Level 26/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

options.A: a bell, sometimes a carrier too.    (b) with two pedals and
options.C: seat and handle along                    (d) Generally, a cycle has an

solution.explanation: Generally, a cycle has an Article ‘a’ is used before words beginning with consonant sound. For example:- a car, a man, a cycle, etc. Similarly, in the given sentence, the word ‘seat’ begins with a consonant sound. Hence, ‘Generally, a cycle has a seat’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Netaji,  a  hero  of  Modern  India,  is  remembered  for  his contribution in the establishment of Indian Army. Graduate Level 26/06/2024 (Shift - 4)

options.C: Netaji, a hero of Modern       (d) India, is remembered for

solution.correct_answer: C. Netaji, a hero of Modern       (d) India, is remembered for
solution.explanation: Netaji, a hero of Modern Article ‘the’ is used before the title given to an important personality. ‘Hero of Modern India’ is a title given to ‘Netaji’. Hence, ‘Netaji, the Hero of Modern’ is the most appropriate answer. SSC CHSL 2023 Tier - 2

question: Sincere  students  /  like  you  and  he  should  study  / regularly to pass the examination. SSC CHSL Tier II  (02/11/2023)

options.A: Sincere students            (b) regularly to pass the examination.
options.D: like you and he should study

solution.explanation: No error. The given sentence is grammatically correct.

question: While  astrology  has/  a  long  history  /  it  is  generally/ considered pseudoscience. SSC CHSL Tier II  (10/01/2024)

solution.explanation: considered pseudoscience The ‘pseudoscience’ mentioned in the given sentence is not speciﬁc and we generally use the indeﬁnite article ‘a’ before a non-speciﬁc noun. Hence, ‘considered a pseudoscience’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: I  have  three  sisters:  /  Meera  is  the  elder  /  and  Charu  is the youngest. SSC CHSL Tier II  (10/01/2024)

solution.explanation: Meera is the elder ‘Elder’ must be replaced with ‘eldest’. The deﬁnite article ‘the’ is used before a superlative degree. Hence, ‘Meera is the eldest’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: A  man  who  has  been  accused  of  fraud  /  in  an  earlier  job, he will never be / welcome in any other organisation. SSC CHSL Tier II  (10/01/2024)

options.C: A man who has been accused of fraud
options.D: in an earlier job, he will never be

solution.correct_answer: D. in an earlier job, he will never be
solution.explanation: in an earlier job, he will never be ‘A man’ is already mentioned as a subject of this sentence. We cannot use ‘he’ in the sentence as it becomes the case of superﬂuousness(not necessary). Therefore, ‘he’ must be removed from the sentence. Hence, ‘in an earlier job, will never be’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: It  is  a  well-known  fact/  that  the  Monarchy  is  /  not  the best form /of governance. SSC CHSL Tier II  (10/01/2024)

solution.explanation: that the Monarchy is Article ‘the’ must be removed. No article is used before the forms of government such as democracy, plutocracy, dictatorship, monarchy. Hence, ‘that Monarchy is’ is the most appropriate answer. SSC CPO 2023 Tier - 2

question: Specialists  say  that  this  method  speeds  up  language learning tremendously. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

solution.explanation: No error . The given sentence is grammatically correct.

question: Two  elderly  gentlemen  told  the  rather  improbable  story  to mislead the police personnel. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

solution.explanation: told the rather improbable ‘The’ must be replaced with ‘a’. Article ‘the’ is used for speciﬁc or particular nouns but the ‘story’ mentioned in the sentence is not speciﬁc. Hence, ‘told a rather improbable’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: We  cannot  postpone  discussion  on  this  issue  although  it is urgent. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

solution.explanation: although it is urgent. ‘Although’ must be replaced with ‘as / because’. The issue is urgent, that is why discussion on it can not be postponed. Here, we need a connector to show the cause or reason. Hence, ‘because it is urgent’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Are you yet afraid of going out in the dark? SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

solution.explanation: Are you yet ‘Yet’ must be replaced with ‘still’. ‘Yet’ is used to show contrast between two events. ‘Still’ is used to show that an action was happening in the past and continuing in the present. Hence, ‘Are you still’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Rohit Sharma’s century was very acclaimed  in the media. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

solution.explanation: very acclaimed ‘Very’ must be replaced with ‘much’. ‘Very’ is used with present participles(V ing ), not with past participles(V 3 ). Hence, ‘much acclaimed’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: You  can  take  a  horse  to  the  water  but  you  cannot  make  it to drink. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

solution.explanation: make it to drink. ‘To’ must be removed. There are some verbs that take a bare inﬁnitive(without ‘to’) after them. These are ‘make, let, bid, see, watch, observe’. Hence, ‘make it drink’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select  the  most  appropriate  option  that  rectiﬁes  the error(s) in the following sentence. One must do his/her duty proparly. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

options.A: One must do ones duty properly.
options.B: One must do one’s duty properly.
options.C: One must do once duty proparly.
options.D: One must do one’s duti proprly.

solution.correct_answer: B. One must do one’s duty properly.
solution.explanation: One must do one’s duty properly. Each pronoun has its own possessive adjective. For example - (I/my), (he/his), (she/her), (one/one’s). Hence, option (b) is the correct sentence.

question: It  is  time  someone  takes  concrete  steps  to  alleviate  the problem of unemployment in the country. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

options.A: the problem of unemployment  (b) It is time someone takes

solution.explanation: It is time someone takes Simple Past Tense(Subject + V 2 ) is used after phrases such as “It is time / It is about time / It is high time”. Therefore, ‘takes’ will be replaced with ‘took(V 2 )’. Hence, ‘It is time someone took’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The food was not as delicious as we had expected. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

solution.explanation: No error. The given sentence is grammatically correct.

question: None  than  you  deserve  credit  for  the  success  of  this project. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

solution.explanation: None than you ‘Than’ must be replaced with ‘but’. The correct phrase is ‘none but’ or ‘none other than’, which means ‘only’. Hence, ‘none but you’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Hold  my  hand  lest  you  should  not  get  lost  in  the  huge crowd at the fair. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

solution.explanation: lest you should not ‘Lest’ is used without ‘not’. Hence, ‘lest you should’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: I  will  deﬁnitely  accept  the  responsibility  while  the  time comes. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

solution.explanation: while the time comes ‘While’ must be replaced with ‘when’. The phrase ‘when the time comes’ is used to state an action that will be done in the suitable circumstances. Hence, ‘when the time comes’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Let  us  work  out  the  details  of  our  endeavour,  shouldn’t we? SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

solution.explanation: shouldn’t we ‘Shall we’ is the correct question tag for an imperative sentence starting with ‘let us’. Hence, ‘shall we’ is the most appropriate answer. SSC CGL 2023 Tier - 2

question: This is the book whom I wanted to buy. SSC CGL Tier II  (26/10/2023)

options.A: the book   (b) wanted to buy.    (c) whom I    (d) This is

solution.explanation: whom I ‘Whom’ must be replaced with ‘which’. ‘Whom’ is used for a person whereas ‘which’ is used for things(book). Hence, ‘which I’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Everyone  should  respect  those  parents,  teachers,  and elders. SSC CGL Tier II  (26/10/2023)

solution.explanation: respect those ‘His’ is used with ‘everybody / everyone / somebody / someone / nobody / no one’ if the gender is unknown. Similarly, the given sentence talks about every single person, both male and female. Hence, ‘respect his’ is the most appropriate answer.
married happily ‘Happily’ is an adverb that will be used before the adjective ‘married’ to modify its meaning. Hence, ‘happily married’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  speaker’s  emphasiss  is  on  the  present-day  problems that are being faced by ordinary men of India. SSC CGL Tier II  (26/10/2023)

options.A: that are being faced             (b) on the present-day problems
options.C: by ordinary men of India      (d) The speaker’s emphasiss is

solution.explanation: The speaker’s emphasiss is ‘Emphasis’ is the correct spelling.

question: They want to live in ﬁrst ﬂoor of this building. SSC CGL Tier II  (26/10/2023)

solution.explanation: live in ﬁrst ﬂoor ‘Live in ﬁrst ﬂoor’ must be replaced with ‘live on the ﬁrst ﬂoor’. Deﬁnite article ‘the’ is used before a superlative degree adjective. ‘First’ is a superlative adjective. ‘On’ is used to indicate the surface on which something rests. ‘Floor’ is the bottom surface of a room. Hence, ‘live on the ﬁrst ﬂoor’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: We / has seen / that movie / before. SSC CGL Tier II  (26/10/2023)

options.A: has seen          (b) before          (c) that movie          (d) We

solution.correct_answer: A. has seen          (b) before          (c) that movie          (d) We
solution.explanation: has seen According to the “Subject-Verb Agreement Rule”, a singular subject always takes a singular verb and a plural subject always takes a plural verb. question: Parts  of  the  following  sentence  have  been  underlined  and given as options. Select the option that contains an error. What  most off  us  want most  is to  move forward  . SSC MTS 11/09/2023 (1st Shift)

options.A: most off    (b) is to   (c) want most    (d) move forward

solution.correct_answer: A. most off    (b) is to   (c) want most    (d) move forward
solution.explanation: most off ‘Off’ must be replaced with ‘of’ as ‘Off’ is usually used as a preposition to indicate separation (going away from something) or disconnection. Preposition ‘Of’ is used to indicate something being part of something. Therefore, ‘most of’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: This  is  the  eldest  standing  structure  of  Chola  architecture in India. SSC MTS 11/09/2023 (2nd Shift) www.ssccglpinnacle.com                                                 Download Pinnacle Exam Preparation App Search on TG: @apna_pdf Pinnacle Spot the Error

options.A: This is the more older standing structure of Chola
options.B: This is the most old standing structure of Chola architecture
options.C: This is the more elder standing structure of Chola
options.D: This is the oldest standing structure of Chola architecture in

solution.correct_answer: D. This is the oldest standing structure of Chola architecture in
solution.explanation: This is the oldest standing structure of Chola architecture in India. ‘Eldest’ must be replaced with ‘oldest’. We use superlative degree 'eldest' for blood relations of the same generation or lower generation & 'oldest' for something that was created ﬁrst of all. Hence, ‘option (d)’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: They  decided  to  /  travel  in  train  /  instead  of  driving  /  to New Delhi. SSC MTS 11/09/2023 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: travel in train Preposition ‘in’ must be replaced with ‘by’ as preposition ‘by’ is used with the means or method of transportation. For example- by train, by bus, by car, etc. Hence, ‘travel by train’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Radha  will  have  learnt  cooking  by  the  time  she  will  have married. SSC MTS 11/09/2023 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: she will have married ‘Will have’ must be replaced with ‘will be’. Simple Present Tense(Singular Sub. + V-s/es) is used with the phrase ‘by the time’ to indicate the point of time in the future when some action will have been completed. Hence, ‘she marries’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  SNAP-10  A  /  was  launched  on  3  April  1965  /  on  a Atlas-Agena D rocket / from Vandenberg Air Force Base. SSC MTS 12/09/2023 (1st Shift)

options.A: at Vandenberg Air Force Base (b) A SNAP-10 A
options.C: was launch on 3 April 1965      (d) on an Atlas-Agena D rocket

solution.explanation: on an Atlas-Agena D rocket Article ‘a’ must be replaced with ‘article ‘an’ as we generally use article ‘an’ with the nouns starting with a vowel sound. Similarly, in the given sentence, ‘Atlas-Agena D’ starts with a vowel sound. Hence, ‘an’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Parts  of  the  given  sentence  have  been  underlined.  One  of them  contains  an  error.  The  underlined  parts  are  given  as options  with  some  changes.  Select  the  option  that  correctly rectiﬁes the error. This car is  lesser  expensive than the  one  I had  come  to buy. SSC MTS 12/09/2023 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: less ‘Lesser’ is used to indicate something of lower importance or signiﬁcance & ‘less’ used to indicate a lower amount or degree. Hence, ‘less’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Choose the sentence that contains an error. SSC MTS 12/09/2023 (2nd Shift)

options.A: I love the taste of fresh strawberries in the summer.
options.B: She is the winner of the Nobel Peace Prize.
options.C: He is chef who specialises in Italian cuisine.
options.D: The Earth revolves around the Sun.

solution.correct_answer: C. He is chef who specialises in Italian cuisine.
solution.explanation: He is chef who specialises in Italian cuisine. The article ‘the’ is used to refer to speciﬁc or particular nouns. Similarly, in the given sentence, ‘chef’ is a speciﬁc person. Hence, ‘He is the chef who specialises in Italian cuisine’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Parts of the following sentence have been underlined  and given as options. Select the option that contains an error. We  think  of  the  past  history  of  the  world  as  ﬁxed  but  of  the future  as undecided  and open to a  wealth off  possibilities. SSC MTS 12/09/2023 (2nd Shift)

options.A: of the past     (b) as undecided     (c) as ﬁxed      (d) wealth off

solution.explanation: wealth off ‘Wealth of something’ is the correct phrase which means a lot of something. Hence, ‘wealth of’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: My teacher told me that / all that /glitters  was not gold. SSC MTS 12/09/2023 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: glitters was not gold ‘Was’ must be replaced with ‘is’ as we generally use Simple Present Tense to write proverbs or old sayings. ‘All that glitters is not gold’ is a proverb which means everything that shines is not necessarily good from inside. Hence, ‘glitters is not gold’ is the most appropriate answer.
A ‘Is’ must be replaced with ‘has been’ as we generally use present perfect tense(has/have + V 3 ) to discuss a situation that began in

question: Henry  is  known  /  as  an  excellent  writer  /  and  good communicator/in English. SSC MTS 12/09/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: and good communicator Use of the adjective 'good' is superﬂuous in this sentence as there is already an adjective(excellent) which qualiﬁes the meaning of both the nouns, 'writer' and 'communicator'. Therefore, 'good' must be removed. Hence, 'and communicator' is the most appropriate answer.

question: With  cloud  streaming,  people  can  play  games  from  a  / internet-connected device, avoiding the need for pricey / dedicated hardware such as a game console. SSC MTS 13/09/2023 (1st Shift)

options.B: dedicated hardware such as a game console
options.C: With cloud streaming, people can play games from a
options.D: internet-connected device, avoiding the need for pricey

solution.correct_answer: C. With cloud streaming, people can play games from a
solution.explanation: With cloud streaming, people can play games from a The article ‘An’ is used before the words starting from a vowel sound(an imminent danger, an apple). Similarly, the word ‘internet’ starts with a vowel sound. Hence, ‘With cloud streaming, people can play games from an’ is the most appropriate answer.

B We use the phrase 'including' to give further examples of people or things that we are talking about. The phrase 'come with' means having something as an essential part. Similarly, warranty is an essential part of the fridge. ’Hence, 'comes with' is the most appropriate answer.

question: Parts  of  the  following  sentence  have  been  underlined  and given as options. Select the option that contains an error. To  much  seriousness  hardens  the  world,  pinning  it  down  with rules  . SSC MTS 13/09/2023 (2nd Shift)

options.A: with rules   (b) hardens the   (c) to much   (d) world, pinning

solution.explanation: to much ‘To’ must be replaced with ‘too’ as ‘too’ is used to indicate an excessive or more than necessary amount. Hence, ‘too much’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The boy whose the sister is ill has left. SSC MTS 13/09/2023 (2nd Shift)

options.A: is ill  (b) has left    (c) The boy    (d) whose the sister

solution.explanation: whose the sister Article ‘the’ must be removed before ‘sister’ as the word ‘whose’ is used to indicate possession or association, and it should be followed directly by the noun it is describing. Hence, ‘whose sister’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  space  agency  wanted  /  to  test  with  a  chimp  /  before orbiting a astronaut / in a Mercury capsule. SSC MTS 13/09/2023 (3rd Shift)

options.A: The space agency want            (b) in an Mercury capsule.
options.C: before orbiting an astronaut    (d) to test with an chimp

solution.correct_answer: C. before orbiting an astronaut    (d) to test with an chimp
solution.explanation: before orbiting an astronaut Article ‘A’ is used before the words starting from a consonant sound - (a conversation, a story). Whereas, the article ‘An’ is used before the words starting with a vowel sound(an imminent danger, an apple). Similarly, in the given sentence, ‘astronaut’ is a noun starting with a vowel sound. Hence, ‘an astronaut’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: If  he  had  paid  /  attention  to  the  announcement,  /  he  had not / missed the train. SSC MTS 13/09/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: he had not The given sentence is an example of a third conditional sentence and the correct grammatical structure is “If + past perfect(had + V 3 )…….. Would have + V 3 ”. Hence, ‘he would not have’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: He is the better-looking hero in the entire  ﬁlm industry. SSC MTS 13/09/2023 (3rd Shift)

options.A: He is the best-looking hero in the entire ﬁlm industry.
options.B: He is the good-looking hero than the entire ﬁlm industry.
options.C: He is the best-looking hero more than the entire ﬁlm industry.
options.D: He is the good-looking hero in the entire ﬁlm industry.

solution.correct_answer: A. He is the best-looking hero in the entire ﬁlm industry.
solution.explanation: He is the best-looking hero in the entire ﬁlm industry.(Correct) (b) He is the good-looking hero than the entire ﬁlm industry.(Incorrect Degree) (c) He is the best-looking hero more than the entire ﬁlm industry.(Incorrect Word) (d) He is the good-looking hero in the entire ﬁlm industry.(Incorrect Degree)

question: When Nisha will have ﬁnished her task? SSC MTS 14/09/2023 (1st Shift)

options.B: When Nisha will    (c) ﬁnished   (d) her task

solution.correct_answer: B. When Nisha will    (c) ﬁnished   (d) her task
solution.explanation: when Nisha will ‘Nisha will’ must be replaced with ‘will Nisha’ as the correct grammatical structure to form interrogative sentences is “Wh. Word + Helping Verb + Subject + Main Verb”. Hence, ‘when will Nisha’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: My  daughter  was  /  invited  to  lunch  /  hosted  by  the Governor / at his residence. SSC MTS 14/09/2023 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: invited to lunch When we talk about a meal(lunch/dinner/breakfast) as a special event, we use the article 'the' before the meal. For ex- the lunch with the president of India. Hence, ‘invited to the lunch’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  new  software  /  consists  from  /several  features  /  and tools. SSC MTS 14/09/2023 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: consists from ‘Of’ is a ﬁxed preposition used after the verb ‘consist’. Hence, ‘consists of’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: If you work hard, you secure good marks. SSC MTS 14/09/2023 (2nd Shift)

options.A: good marks   (b) If you   (c) work hard  (d) you secure

solution.explanation: you secure The given sentence is an example of the ﬁrst conditional sentence and the correct grammatical structure is “if + simple present…….will +V 1 ”. Hence,‘you will secure’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The cholera is a frightful disease. SSC MTS 14/09/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.correct_answer: B. The cholera        (c) frightful disease       (d) a
solution.explanation: The cholera Article ‘the’ must be removed before ‘cholera’ as we generally don’t use the deﬁnite article ‘the’ before the names of illnesses or diseases. Hence, ‘cholera’ is the most appropriate answer.

options.B: He  is  the  good-looking  hero  than  the  entire  ﬁlm
options.C: He  is  the  best-looking  hero  more  than  the  entire  ﬁlm

solution.explanation: C We generally use Simple Present Tense(Plural Sub. + V 1 ) for generally held beliefs or opinions. Similarly, the given sentence states an opinion about twins. Hence, 'they resemble(V 1 )' is the most appropriate answer. SSC CHSL 2023 Tier - 1

question: He / lives / in 45 Church Street / with his  family. SSC CHSL 02/08/2023 (4th Shift)

options.A: in 45 Church Street    (b) with his family     (c) lives  (d) He

solution.correct_answer: A. in 45 Church Street    (b) with his family     (c) lives  (d) He
solution.explanation: in 45 Church Street ‘In’ must be replaced with ‘at’ as we generally use the preposition ‘at’ for smaller or speciﬁc locations. Hence, ‘at 45 Church Street’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: He  sang  /  beautifully  but  /  the  judges  were  /  unimpress at the end. SSC CHSL 02/08/2023 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: unimpress at the end ‘Unimpress’ must be replaced with the adjective ‘unimpressed’ as we generally use adjectives after stative verbs(‘were’ in the given sentence). Hence, ‘unimpressed at the end’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Identify  the  error  in  the  use  of  preposition  in  the  given sentence and select the correct option. Radhika  is  not  capable  on  participating  in  a  national  level competition. SSC CHSL 03/08/2023 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: of Use of ‘on’ after the word ‘capable’ is incorrect. ‘On’ must be replaced with ‘of’ as ‘of’ is a ﬁxed preposition used after the word ‘capable’ to denote capability. Hence, ‘of’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: In  course  by  time,  /  he  was  wise  enough  to  realise  /  the mistakes of his past life. SSC CHSL 03/08/2023 (3rd Shift)

options.B: he was wise enough to realise
options.C: the mistakes of his past life.

solution.explanation: In course by time ‘By’ must be replaced with ‘of’ as ‘in course of time’ is the correct phrase. This phrase is used when something happens over a period of time. Hence, ‘in course of time’ is the most appropriate answer.

options.A: I like my puppies, Mac and Matt, but I like Matt better.
options.B: I like my puppies, Mac and Matt, but I like Matt the best.
options.C: I like my puppies, Mac and Matt, but I like Matt much.
options.D: I like my puppies, Mac and Matt, but I like Matt most.

solution.correct_answer: A. I like my puppies, Mac and Matt, but I like Matt better.
solution.explanation: I like my puppies, Mac and Matt, but I like Matt better. (Correct) (b) I like my puppies, Mac and Matt, but I like Matt the best . (Incorrect Degree) (c) I like my puppies, Mac and Matt, but I like Matt much . (Incorrect Degree) (d) I like my puppies, Mac and Matt, but I like Matt most . (Incorrect Degree)

question: The  current  state  of  the  literature  /  on  the  eﬃcacy  under cognitive-behavioural  therapy  /  for  individuals  with  generalised anxiety  disorder  /  suggests  that  it  is  a  promising  treatment option. www.ssccglpinnacle.com                                                 Download Pinnacle Exam Preparation App Search on TG: @apna_pdf Pinnacle Spot the Error SSC CHSL 04/08/2023 (3rd Shift)

options.A: The current state of the literature
options.B: suggests that it is a promising treatment option
options.C: on the eﬃcacy under cognitive-behavioural therapy
options.D: for individuals with generalised anxiety disorder.

solution.correct_answer: C. on the eﬃcacy under cognitive-behavioural therapy
solution.explanation: on the eﬃcacy under cognitive-behavioural therapy ‘Under’ must be replaced with ‘of’. ‘Under’ is used to denote the position of something/somebody at a lower level. ‘Of’ is used to mention the parts or characteristics of something. Hence, ‘on the eﬃcacy of cognitive-behavioural therapy’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The rich / should / help / poor. SSC CHSL 04/08/2023 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: poor Article ‘the’ is used when we use an adjective to represent the whole class. Similarly, in the given sentence, we are referring to the whole class of poor people. Hence, ‘the poor’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: He  was  /  that  angry  /  that  he  slammed  the  book  /  on  the table. SSC CHSL 07/08/2023 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: that angry ‘That angry’ must be replaced with ‘so angry’ as ‘so…that’ is a ﬁxed conjunction pair. Hence, ‘so angry’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: After  working  so  much  /  in  the  ﬁelds  yesterday  /  did  you took a break? SSC CHSL 07/08/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.correct_answer: A. did you took a break
solution.explanation: did you took a break ‘Took’ must be replaced with ‘take’ as we generally use the ﬁrst form of the verb(V 1 ) after ‘did’. Hence, ‘did you take a break’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Do  you  want  /  to  visit  a  zoo  /  when  you  /  go  to Ahmedabad? SSC CHSL 07/08/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: to visit a zoo Article ‘a’ must be replaced with ‘the’ to specify a particular zoo. Hence, ‘to visit the zoo’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Suman has bought / a black and a white shawl  / to wear with / her new dress. SSC CHSL 07/08/2023 (4th Shift)

options.C: a black and a white shawl

solution.correct_answer: C. a black and a white shawl
solution.explanation: a black and a white shawl Article ‘a’ must be removed before ‘white’. We use article ‘a’ once when there is only one person or thing. Hence, ‘a black and white shawl’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Nobody  from  the  gathering  /  of  odd  people  could  guess  / the accident occurring blast. SSC CHSL 08/08/2023 (2nd Shift)

options.A: the accident occurring blast    (b) Nobody from the gathering

solution.correct_answer: A. the accident occurring blast    (b) Nobody from the gathering
solution.explanation: the accident occurring blast ‘Occurring’ must be replaced with ‘that caused the’ as ‘caused’ means to make something happen. The phrase "that caused the blast" is used to clarify that the accident was responsible for the blast. Hence, ‘that caused the blast’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: I  have  read  that  /  a  Leaning  Tower  of  Pisa  is  a  /  popular tourist attraction / in the world. SSC CHSL 08/08/2023 (2nd Shift)

options.B: a Leaning Tower of Pisa is a
options.C: popular tourist attraction      (d) in the world

solution.correct_answer: B. a Leaning Tower of Pisa is a
solution.explanation: a Leaning Tower of Pisa is a Article ‘A’ must be replaced with article ‘the’ as we generally use article ‘the’ with a speciﬁc and well-known structure. Hence, ‘the leaning tower of Pisa is a’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Sita  spotted  golden  /  deer  and  /  requested  Rama  /  to capture it. SSC CHSL 08/08/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Sita spotted golden Article ‘A’ is used before the words starting from a consonant sound - (a conversation, a story). Therefore, article ‘a’ must be used before the word ‘golden’. Hence, ‘Sita spotted a golden’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  investigation  conducting  by  the  research  team  / yielded  statistically  signiﬁcant  results  /  providing  substantial evidence / to support the hypothesis. SSC CHSL 08/08/2023 (4th Shift)

options.D: The investigation conducting by the research team

solution.correct_answer: D. The investigation conducting by the research team
solution.explanation: The investigation conducting by the research team. A participle phrase is a group of words which includes a past participle form (V 3 ) and functions as an adjective, providing additional information about the subject. Similarly, In the given sentence, the participle phrase "conducted(V 3 ) by the team" provides additional information about the subject ‘the investigation’. Hence, 'the investigation conducted by the research team' is the most appropriate answer.

question: It  was  Ravi,  not  his  friends,  /  who  were  shouting  /  at  late hours last night. SSC CHSL 08/08/2023 (4th Shift)

options.A: It was Ravi, not his friends,   (b) No error
options.C: who were shouting                 (d) at late hours last night.

solution.correct_answer: C. who were shouting                 (d) at late hours last night.
solution.explanation: who were shouting ‘Were’ must be replaced with ‘was.’ According to the “Subject-Verb Agreement Rule”, a singular subject always takes a singular verb and a plural subject always takes a plural verb. ‘Ravi’ is a singular subject that will take ‘was’ as a singular verb. Hence, ‘who was shouting’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Washington Irving's writing career started  at / the tender age  of  nineteen  when  he  joined  /  his  brother  Peter's  newspaper The Morning Chronicle / as journalist. SSC CHSL 09/08/2023 (1st Shift)

options.A: his brother Peter's newspaper The Morning Chronicle
options.B: Washington Irving's writing career started at
options.D: the tender age of nineteen when he joined

solution.explanation: as journalist Article ‘a’ is used before the words starting from a consonant sound (a conversation, a story). Therefore, article ‘a’ must be used before the word ‘journalist’. Hence, ‘as a journalist’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: There  was  a  saying  that  they’re  their  own  enemies  with negligble reason to be shared. SSC CHSL 09/08/2023 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: negligble ‘Negligible’ is the correct spelling.

question: Can  you  make  /  sure  you  have  /  a  correct  address  / before you start driving? SSC CHSL 09/08/2023 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: a correct address ‘’A correct address’ must be replaced with ‘the correct address’ as we generally use article ‘the’ before deﬁnite or particular nouns. Similarly, the given sentence is talking about a particular address. Hence, ‘the correct address’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  food  container  /  is  not  enough  big  to  meet  /  the demands of the affected people. SSC CHSL 09/08/2023 (3rd Shift)

options.B: is not enough big to meet
options.C: The food container      (d) the demands of the affected people

solution.correct_answer: B. is not enough big to meet
solution.explanation: is not enough big to meet ‘Enough big’ must be replaced with ‘big enough’ as ‘enough’ is a special adverb and always used after the adjective(‘big’ in the given sentence). Hence, ‘is not big enough to meet’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: By  virtue  off  /  the  power  given  to  the  leader  /  the followers accepted his decision SSC CHSL 09/08/2023 (4th Shift)

options.C: the power given to the leader

solution.explanation: By virtue off ‘By virtue of’ is the correct preposition and it is used to provide reason. Hence, ‘by virtue of’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  team  of  scientists  /  were  conducting  /  experiments to test /  their hypothesis SSC CHSL 09/08/2023 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: were conducting According to the “Subject-Verb Agreement Rule”, a singular subject always takes a singular verb and a plural subject always takes a plural verb. ‘Team’ is a singular subject that will take ‘was’ as a singular verb. Hence, ‘was conducting’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: This  region  /  was  struck  by  unusual  /  wave  of  violence  / last year. SSC CHSL 10/08/2023 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: was struck by unusual Article ‘An’ is used before the words starting from a vowel sound(an imminent danger, an apple). Therefore, article ‘an’ must be used before the word ‘unusual’. Hence, ‘was struck by an unusual’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: With  reference  of  your  letter,  /  the  organisation  wishes  to hire you / for the security services. SSC CHSL 10/08/2023 (1st Shift)

options.C: the organisation wishes to hire you

solution.correct_answer: A. With reference of your letter
solution.explanation: With reference of your letter ‘Of’ must be replaced with ‘to’ as ‘with reference to’ is the correct phrase which means about or concerning(something). Hence, ‘with reference to your letter’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: It  is  imperative  in  understanding  /  the  rising  importance of  artiﬁcial  intelligence  /  in  the  public  sector  to  increase  the eﬃcacy / and impact of the work done for public welfare. SSC CHSL 10/08/2023 (4th Shift)

options.A: the rising importance of artiﬁcial intelligence
options.C: and impact of the work done for public welfare.
options.D: in the public sector to increase the eﬃcacy

solution.correct_answer: B. It is imperative in understanding
solution.explanation: It is imperative in understanding ‘In understanding’ must be replaced with ‘to understand’. We generally use the phrase ‘it is imperative/important + to + V 1 ’ when the inﬁnitive(to + V 1 ) tells us what is important. Hence, ‘it is imperative to understand(V 1 )’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  soldier  met  /  a  fearless  death  /  ﬁghting  on  behalf  at his country. SSC CHSL 10/08/2023 (4th Shift)

options.D: ﬁghting on behalf at his country

solution.correct_answer: D. ﬁghting on behalf at his country
solution.explanation: ﬁghting on behalf at his country ‘On behalf at his country’ must be replaced with ‘on behalf of his country’. The phrase ‘on behalf of’ is used to indicate that someone is acting or speaking for another person, group or organisation. Hence, ‘ﬁghting on behalf of his country’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Choose the sentence that contains an error. SSC CHSL 11/08/2023 (1st  Shift)

options.A: I need to buy an new iPhone.
options.B: The cat sat on the windowsill
options.C: She is the best singer in the choir.
options.D: He is an artist who paints landscapes.

solution.correct_answer: A. I need to buy an new iPhone.
solution.explanation: I need to buy an new iPhone.(Incorrect Article) I need to buy a new iPhone.(Correct) Article ‘A’ is used before the words starting from a consonant sound - (a conversation, a story).

question: The man / is a / social animal. SSC CHSL 11/08/2023 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: The man No article is used when a noun is used in the general sense. Therefore, article ‘the’ must be removed before ‘man’. Hence, ‘man’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  poor  undergoes  /  several  problems  in  life  /  that could be / solved with money. SSC CHSL 11/08/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: The poor undergoes An adjective represents the whole class of people when article ‘the’ is used before it. Similarly, ‘the poor’ represents all the poor people. We always use a plural verb after such adjectives. Hence, ‘The poor undergo’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select the grammatically correct sentence. SSC CHSL 11/08/2023 (3rd Shift)

options.A: He ate the sweets greedy.      (b) I could not ﬁnd it anywhere.
options.C: I haven't got none.                    (d) He is much weak.

solution.explanation: I could not ﬁnd it anywhere.(Correct) (a) He ate the sweets greedy .(‘Greedily’ will be used) (c) I haven't got none.(‘Have’ will be used) (d) He is much weak .(‘Weaker’ will be used)

question: Hurray!  Here  is  the  toy  /  what  I  was  looking  for  /  as  my birthday gift. SSC CHSL 14/08/2023 (1st Shift)

solution.correct_answer: C. what I was looking for
solution.explanation: what I was looking for ‘What’ must be replaced with ‘that’ as when we introduce a relative clause that provides more information about a noun, we typically use "that" or "which" instead of "what". Hence, ‘that i was looking for’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  politician  was  accused  /  of  accepting  bribes  /  and lied about it /  to the public. SSC CHSL 14/08/2023 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: and lied about it According to the ‘Rule of Parallelism’, two or more verbs must be in the same form if they are connected with one another. Similarly, in the given sentence, ‘and’ connects two verbs 'accepting(V ing )’ and ‘lied’. Therefore, ‘lying(V ing )’ must be used in place of ‘lied’. Hence, ‘and lying about it’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: These  experiments  had  been  going  on  since  several months. SSC CGL Tier II ( 08/08/2022 )

solution.explanation: Since several months The given sentence is in ‘Past perfect continuous tense (Sub. + had been + V 1 -ing + obj. + since/for + time)’. We generally use ‘since’ to denote a point of time and ‘for’ to denote a period of time. Hence, ‘For several months’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Every Saturday, your mother prepares a pudding,  isn’t she ? SSC CGL Tier II ( 08/08/2022 )

solution.explanation: Isn’t she According to the “Question Tag rule”, if the statement is positive, the question tag will be negative & Vice-versa. However, the sentence and the question tag must be in the same tense. The given sentence is in simple present tense. So the same tense will be used for the question tag. The given sentence is positive so the question tag will be negative (doesn’t). Hence, ‘doesn’t she’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  people  living  in  coastal  areas  were  evacuated  by time. SSC CGL Tier II ( 08/08/2022 )

solution.explanation: By time Phrase ‘By time’ will be replaced by ‘On time’ as both the phrases look similar but have different meanings. ‘On time’ means at a speciﬁc time and ‘By time’ means at the time. Hence, ‘On time’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  gentleman  had  a  suitcase  full  with  wigs,  ornaments and dresses. SSC CGL Tier II ( 08/08/2022 )

solution.explanation: A suitcase full with ‘Full with’ will be replaced with ‘Full of’ as the phrase ‘Full of’ means completely, including the whole of something. Hence, ‘A suitcase full of’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: You  should  tell  these  children  to  complete  their  projects himself. SSC CGL Tier II ( 08/08/2022 )

question: A  man  tends  to  one  /  of  the  horses  after  it’s  /  training  at  a stud farm. SSC MTS 06/07/2022 (Afternoon)

Whereas, “Its” with no apostrophe(‘s) is the possessive form of the pronoun ‘it’ which means belonging to it like the dog hurt its tail. Similarly in the given sentence, training is of a man. Hence, ‘the horses after its’ is the most appropriate answer.
